title.narrative: Diakonia BFA,democracy, human rights, gender eq.

description.narrative: Civil society support to a network of 10 central CSO through Diakonia in Burkina to reinforce the civil society's advocacy and follow up for democratic governance, human rights and gender equality. Prolongations made after the 2014 popular uprising of 1.9MSEK to support the transition towards organising free and fair elections, and of 5MSEK 2015-2016 to support CSO monitoring of the elections.

Stöd till civila samhället via Diakonia och tio centrala CSO med förankring i alla regioner i Burkina Faso för att bidra till demokratisk samhällsstyrning, mänskliga rättigheter och jämställdhet. I samband med folkresningen ökades stödet med 1,9MSEK för att stödja transitionsprocessen mot fria och rättvisa val, samt 2015-2016 lades 5MSEK till budgeten för att stödja civila samhällets valbevakning.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The program's actions covered the period from January to June 30, 2016 and contributed to the five results of the program. Advocacy efforts have resulted in the implementation and enforcement of laws or anti-corruption legal provisions, access to information, decriminalization of press offenses, special status of press companies, child labor, sexual harassment, violence against women and children, abolition of the death penalty. The mechanism for civil society mobilisation that contributed to the political transition initiated in 2014, was continously employed during 2015 to reinforce reforms for example the law projects for strengthened human rights, including a new law against gender-based violence and for the protection of young girls, ratified in 2015.
Diakonia's capacity-building activities have been executed and the partners' ability to diversify their funding sources has increased. The participation of women in politic increased: 305 women councilors out of 1385 following of May 22, 2016 elections. the number of women journalists increased (+ 28%) during this first half of 2016. During the same perio, we recorded 6 women directors press compagnies (DNF, RTB, Femina Fm, Lefaso.net, Burkina 24 and Local radio in the Leo area), 4 female editors or at least 3 female heads of desk.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
